Paul de Rémusat (17 November 1831, Paris – 22 January 1897, Paris), son of the [MASK] politician Charles de Rémusat, became a distinguished journalist and writer.
During the Hundred Days, he followed Louis XVIII into exile; as a reward, he was later promoted to the rank of Lieutenant Commander of the [MASK] Column of the Royal Swiss.
The same year he joined the Mortemart regiment (of his uncle the Duke de Mortemart) of the [MASK] émigré army.
